item.title: Christian add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Christian add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Christian add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Christian add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Christian add a quote by David James Duncan
item.description: "Anyone too undisciplined, too self-righteous or too self-centered to live in the world as it is has a tendency to idealize a world which ought to be. But no matter what political or religious direction such idealists choose, their visions always share one telling characteristic: in their utopias, heavens or brave new worlds, their greatest personal weakness suddenly appears to be a strength." -- David James Duncan

item.title: Christian add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Our species is the only creative species, and it has only one creative instrument, the individual mind and spirit of man. Nothing was ever created by two men. There are no good collaborations, whether in music, in art, in poetry, in mathematics, in philosophy. Once the miracle of creation has taken place, the group can build and extend it, but the group never invents anything. The preciousness lies in the lonely mind of a man." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Christian add a quote by Giovanni Boccaccio
item.description: "To have compassion for those who suffer is a human quality which everyone should possess, especially those who have required comfort themselves in the past and have managed to find it in others. " -- Giovanni Boccaccio

item.title: Christian add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Christian add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Christian add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "If you are too careful, you are so occupied in being careful that you are sure to stumble over something." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "Power doesn’t always roar.... The art of exerting power is an art used in doses - the more hidden it is the more effective." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "You may lose people you love. You may lose things you had.. but no matter what, never lose yourself." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Christian add a quote by A.R. Voss
item.description: "A book is the gateway to the soul of its author." -- A.R. Voss

item.title: Christian add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "Sometimes you don’t realize your own strength until you come face to face with your greatest weakness." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "Building companies rules of the game have all changed today. It used to cost millions of dollars to do anything substantial. You'd get VC backing & then you'd hire the team to build it. Now it's deploy or die." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "When life gives you lemons, order the lobster tail." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Christian add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first draft of anything is shit." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Christian add a quote by Sinclair Lewis
item.description: "It is impossible to discourage the real writers - they don't give a damn what you say, they're going to write" -- Sinclair Lewis
